messages.msgSnippet: ... Very cool! Connecting the dots is what makes world seem cosier and more sensible.  Sandra [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/10/05 7:34:36 PM, kjennings95@... writes:


> my maternal grandfather (CT Elvey)
>

Very cool!
Connecting the dots is what makes world seem cosier and more sensible. <g>

Sandra


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] My claim to fame, was: What is this called?
messages.msgSnippet: Finding this link in my email today was just too cool.  The article in the link is from the Geophysical Institute at the Univ. of Alaska, well, the cool think
messages.messageBody:
Finding this link in my email today was just too cool. The article in the link is from the Geophysical Institute at the Univ. of Alaska, well, the cool think for me is that the Geophysical Institute is named after my maternal grandfather (CT Elvey), who was the director in the 50's and 60's. Unfortunately he died before I was born, but I always get excited to find references to him.
Thanks!
Katy J.

----- Original Message -----
From: Kendra DeSimone<mailto:begentleinspirit@...>
To: UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com<mailto:UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com>

Subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] What is this called?


Vortex

http://www.gi.alaska.edu/ScienceForum/ASF5/523.html<http://www.gi.alaska.edu/ScienceForum/ASF5/523.html>

SandraDodd@...<mailto:SandraDodd@...> wrote:
I've only heard it called swirl or whirlpool. Swirl.
